Quad Area RGB 24 Applet

for microEnable IV AQ4-GE
for microEnable IV VQ4-GE
for microEnable IV-GigE x4
.


Description
..

The hardware applet Quad Area RGB 24 enables the simultanous operation of up to four color scale cameras. Supported are all color scale area-scan cameras with 24bit from GigabitEthernet interface and a resolution of up to 8,192 x 4,096 pixels.


Highlights
.
    General Information:
  • GigE Vision compatible.
  • Camera detection abilities.
  • Support of up to 4 logical cameras.
  • More than 100 meters of cable length supported.
  • The input rate per port is about 100MB/s. The total PCIe output rate is about 750 MB/s on PCIe quad lane systems.
    Because the transfer rate is depending on the PC in combination with the applet, we advise to run a test with microDiagnosis on your target PC and applet for detailed information about the maximum transfer rate on your individual PC.
    Image Generator:
  • An image generator is integrated to select the image source either from camera port or from the generator itself.
  • Additionally, the image generation can manually be started.
  • Image width and height can individually be set, as well as the line gap, the frequency and accuracy (also known as Hd-Sync / prescaler / time base).
  • Tap 1 to 4 can be activated or deactivated.
  • Furthermore, the generated image can be rolled to get a changing image sequence.
    Display:
  • The maximum image dimension is up to 8,192 x 4,096 pixels.
  • X offset and Y offset can also be set of up to 8,192 x 4,096 pixels.
  • 8bit output per color component (Col24).
    White Balancing:
  • White balancing is possible to be adjusted.

    GigabitEthernet:

  • Support of following gray GigabitEthernet input formats:
    • RGB8_PACKED
    • BGR8_PACKED
    • RGBA8_PACKED
    • BGRA8_PACKED
    Preprocessing
  • No preprocessing available at the moment.

    Digital Input / Output

  • For special purposes user defined input and output signals can be used. There are two signals possible, each (input and output). The parameter has to be set in a decimal value (0 to 3) and will be converted to a binary (0 to 11) value.
    Miscellaneous
  • Following properties can be read:
    • Camera status
    • Extended camera status
    • DMA transfer length
    • Timestamp

.


References
.

SDK Documentation
.


Parameter Table

Parameter Description Unit Access Type Range Default Value
FG_WIDTH Image width of the acquisition window. [pixels] Read/Write int 4-8192 1024
FG_HEIGHT Image height of the acquisition window. [pixels] Read/Write int 4-4096 1024
FG_XOFFSET Horizontal offset of the image. [pixels] Read/Write int 0-8192 0
FG_YOFFSET Vertical offset of the image. [pixels] Read/Write int 0-4096 0
FG_FORMAT Pixel format of the output image. N/A Read/Write int
  • FG_COL24
    		•  FG_COL24
    FG_CAMSTATUS Camera Status. N/A Read Only int 0-0 0
    FG_GBE_CAMTYP Gigabit Ethernet camera type. N/A Read/Write int
  • RGB8_PACKED
  • BGR8_PACKED
  • RGBA8_PACKED
  • BGRA8_PACKED
    		•  RGB8_PACKED
    FG_MEDIAN N/A N/A Read/Write int
  • 0
  • 1
    		•  0
